div.bibl: Dziennik Chicagoski, Apr. 13, 1894. POLISH WOMEN'S CENTRAL SOCIETY OF CHICAGO AND THE LWOW FAIR

body.p: The Polish Women's Central Society of Chicago, whose president is Mrs. Theophilia Samolinski, has sent its history to the Lwow Exposition. The binding of the book is beautiful. The society also donated five dollars for the Polish pavilion.
Sincere thanks are extended to the donors.
This society was organized in 1887. Today it numbers 190 members.
Its motto is: "God, Faith, and Motherland."
Lectures on Polish and general history are given at its meetings. The society participates in national celebrations and anniversaries.
